text.title: part1_BDSM as business: Interviews with Dominatrixes

s.hi: DS : Does BDSM turn you on ?

p.s: The majority of the time I do n’t get any sexual pleasure out of it .
There are going to be times in session because of the way I ’m dressed …

s.hi: DS : Outside of work is it something that is an interest of yours ?

p.s: A little bit , but definitely not the majority of time .

s.hi: DS : Did it start out that it was a turn-on and then you just moved on ?

p.s: Yeah , because I ’m very experimental by nature .
I love learning about things , and I imagine you are the same way because you do all this research on different topics !

s.hi:
DS : True ; tomorrow I ’m talking to a
Presidential candidate
and the President of the ACLU .

p.s: transition !

I would love for you to
combine
these two things and bring
in
that
Republican candidate
here , and then perhaps we could…somehow it would be very satisfying .

s.hi: DS : So BDSM is something that you had a curiosity about , experienced it , you realized you had a talent , and made it into a profession ?

p.s: I realized I was good at it and I enjoyed it ; I enjoyed the variety and the different people I was hanging out with , people like Jada .
It ’s much better than just playing .

s.hi: DS : How did you start , Jada ?

p.s:
I always had an interest in
S&M
.
As a teenager it was one of those things that I did n’t know exactly what it was , but I was always into the fetish , the kink , the tying up , the doing all sorts of different things .
Then I was in a relationship where there was no communication .

s.hi: DS : Was it an S&M relationship ?

p.s: Just a regular relationship .
There was no communication going on , nothing happening , no intimacy , and after awhile we were literally at the point where we were going to break up .

I was going to break up with him , and then he told me had a
bondage fetish
.
So I was like , “ Fine , okay ! That ’s perfect , if that ’s the only problem that you have , you know , let ’s do this ! ”

hi.s:
Is that
why
things were going down the toilet , because he had that desire and he would n’t express it ?

p.s: Yes , he had expressed it in previous relationships , and because he expressed it he was seen as a freak .
“ How dare you !
That ’s the equivalent of rape ! ”

s.hi: DS : So he learned not to express it and that caused him to not communicate …

p.s: Exactly .

s.hi: DS : And he just assumed you were somebody who —
